Class LevelComplete

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • LevelComplete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LevelComplete
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class displays a screen after the user finishes each level. Note that since javadoc is not picking up caught exceptions, we included the exceptions in the local variables.

    Verison 1 (2 Hours): The background and the setHighscores implemetation added, as well as the other methods.

    Version:
    1 05.26.16 Program name: LevelComplete.java
    Author:
    Aashmika Mali
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelComplete

        public LevelComplete()
        This is the constructor for level complete. Depending on the level(decided by the ifs), it will call the setHighscores method in Highscores, to set the highscores before displaying to the user if their score is high scores worthy. A mouse listener is added to see if the user pressed continue, if it was the last level.

        Local variables:

        c Of type Countdown, it creates a new countdown for the next level.

        e Of type MouseEvent, used when the mouseListener for mousePressed is added.

        relativeX It is an int that has the temporary mouse click x coordinate.

        relativeY It is an int that has the temporary mouse click y coordinate.

        c Of type certificate, it is created if the level completed was the third level.

        cont This points to the Action class.

        Parameters:

        e Points to the ActionEvent class.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This is the paint method in the class. It draws the BufferedImage of the background on the frame, and also draws the text with the user's score, name, and if they are on the high scores board.

        Local variables:

        background Of type BufferedImage, it is used when drawing the background.

        Parameters:

        e Of type MouseEvent, used when the mouseListener for mousePressed is added.

        Exceptions:

        w Of type IOException, it is caught when reading the image from a file.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - This is needed to draw the image onto the screen
